intro: Lappula persica, commonly known as Persian lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical structure of Lappula persica reflects its evolutionary adaptations to survive in dry climates.
